title: truffle test ignores config values from truffle.js (e.g. a gas value)
body:
As a result, any big contract fails to deploy before tests are run.
Looks like the problem in this deploy() function:

https://github.com/ConsenSys/truffle/blob/master/lib/test.js#L90

The options object is created on the fly and the gas value is not there.

This should have been fixed in version 2.0.4. Could upgrade and let me know
if that fixes your issue?

On Jul 21, 2016 11:17 PM, "Vadim" notifications@github.com wrote:

> As a result, big contract fails to deploy before tests are run.
> Looks like the problem in this deploy() function:
> 
> https://github.com/ConsenSys/truffle/blob/master/lib/test.js#L90
> 
> The options object is created on the fly and a gas value is not there.
>

I'm running truffle 2.0.4. It was fixed for truffle migrate command, but not for truffle test. Here is how it works:

`$ truffle migrate --verbose-rpc
Compiling Registrar.sol...
Writing artifacts to ./build/contracts

> {
>   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>   "method": "eth_accounts",
>   "params": [],
>   "id": 1
> }
>  <   {
>  <     "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>  <     "id": 1,
>  <     "result": [
>  <       "0xd4aa85f84dc132be2203c53b53e67f17ed06219e",
>  <       "0x41e1603d32eedeb352c8c92e8f065832285535d4"
>  <     ]
>  <   }
> Running migration: 1_initial_migration.js
>   Deploying Migrations...
> {
>   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>   "method": "eth_sendTransaction",
>   "params": [
>     {
>       "from": "0xd4aa85f84dc132be2203c53b53e67f17ed06219e",
>    **>       "gas": "0x1e8480",**
>       "gasPrice": "0x174876e800",
>       "data": ""
>     }
>   ],
>   "id": 1
> }`

Note that "gas" and "gasPrice" are present in the sendTransaction call. Now with truffle test:

`$ truffle test test/registrar.js --verbose-rpc

> {
>   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>   "method": "eth_accounts",
>   "params": [],
>   "id": 1
> }
>  <   {
>  <     "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>  <     "id": 1,
>  <     "result": [
>  <       "0xd4aa85f84dc132be2203c53b53e67f17ed06219e",
>  <       "0x41e1603d32eedeb352c8c92e8f065832285535d4"
>  <     ]
>  <   }

  Contract: Registrar

> {
>   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>   "method": "eth_accounts",
>   "params": [],
>   "id": 2
> }
>  <   {
>  <     "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>  <     "id": 2,
>  <     "result": [
>  <       "0xd4aa85f84dc132be2203c53b53e67f17ed06219e",
>  <       "0x41e1603d32eedeb352c8c92e8f065832285535d4"
>  <     ]
>  <   }
> {
>   "jsonrpc": "2.0",
>   "method": "eth_sendTransaction",
>   "params": [
>     {
>       "from": "0xd4aa85f84dc132be2203c53b53e67f17ed06219e",
>       "data": ""
>     }
>   ],
>   "id": 1
> }
> `

Now sendTransaction has no gas values set, so contract does not get deployed:

`1) "before all" hook: prepare suite

  0 passing (9s)
  1 failing

  1) Contract: Registrar "before all" hook: prepare suite:
     Error: The contract code couldn't be stored, please check your gas amount.
      at Object.callback (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/ether-pudding/node_modules/web3/lib/web3/contract.js:147:46)
      at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/ether-pudding/node_modules/web3/lib/web3/method.js:142:25
      at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/ether-pudding/node_modules/web3/lib/web3/requestmanager.js:89:9
      at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/lib/provider.js:27:9
      at request.onreadystatechange (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/web3/lib/web3/httpprovider.js:114:13)
      at dispatchEvent (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js:591:25)
      at setState (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js:610:14)
      at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/truffle/node_modules/xmlhttprequest/lib/XMLHttpRequest.js:447:13)
      at endReadableNT (_stream_readable.js:926:12)
      at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:74:11)
      at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:122:9)
`
Hmm. Nothing in Truffle ever sets the gas limit to `0x1e8480`. Can you double check your application to ensure this isn't coming from your side?
Ah, nevermind. I misinterpreted. Let me look into it.
This has been fixed for a few weeks now. I'm going to close this ticket. Let me know if you are still having issues.
